name: Silus
descriptions: Silus is a centurion of Caesar's Legion, captured during battle and brought to Camp McCarran in 2281.

An exceptional member of the Legion, Silus is unique not in bravery, but in his insight and intelligence, as despite Legion indoctrination, he has managed to retain freedom of thought and skills of critical observation. He earned the rank of centurion through bravery and devotion, serving Caesar unquestioningly for years. Among many, he and his men wiped out countless NCR patrols to allow Legion operatives to move freely,

He was not blind to Caesar's degenerating health, or his own worth. Before his last mission, he waited for three days until his leader's headache subsided, despite the time-critical nature of his assignment. The delay resulted in Silus' centuria being ambushed and routed by the NCR.
Silus recognized Captain Ronald Curtis upon being brought into the base, having met him years earlier during the latter's frumentarii training. He did not know his current name,

While Lt. Boyd tries, in vain, to pry some useful information from him, Silus continues to believe that he is still a loyal officer of the Legion, as he refused to kill one of its greatest soldiers (himself) and did not divulge even the slightest bit of information.

Silus Treatment: Silus is held captive in Camp McCarran, and the NCR is attempting to interrogate him. He will not give information to the NCR, and interrogator Carrie Boyd is looking for help. She informs the player character that the NCR does not allow torture of prisoners. They can suggest a truth serum, beating the prisoner, or calling him names. Silus may also be freed, resulting in a few special dialogue lines from Caesar.
Silus has a low intelligence dialogue option, though it's limited to a single line.
Silus directly translates to "snub-nosed" in Latin.

Frumentarii: Alerio · Cato Hostilius · Gabban · Karl · Picus · Disguised frumentarius · Ulysses (formerly)
Consul: M. Licinius Crassus · M. Scribonius Libo Drusus (of the consul)

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: What an ugly little worm you are. What pile of excrement did the lieutenant pluck you from, worm?

topics.topic_text: I'm a friend of the Legion. I'm here to help.
topics.response_text: Caesar's eyes truly are everywhere. And here I thought they'd send assassins instead. Did the officer send you?{relieved}

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I'm with the Legion. I'm here to kill you before you talk.
topics.response_text: [?] You're nothing. You're some inept mercenary the NCR is paying to supplement its own incompetent soldiers.

topics.topic_text: [Speech] I think you're confused. I'm with the excrement right now.
topics.response_text: [?] You must have some reason to be in your line of work. Tell me, what did the Legion do to you?

topics.topic_text: [Speech] You... *smell* like excrement. So there.
topics.response_text: [FAILED] I must admit that a conversation with an imbecile may be far worse than the kind of torture I was anticipating.

topics.topic_text: You're about to tell me everything you know, Silus.
topics.response_text: Of course, of course. All you had to do was ask. I'll tell you everything I know.

topics.topic_text: [Attack] Uh oh. Now you've made me angry.
topics.response_text: I can take anything you've got.

topics.topic_text: What officer?
topics.response_text: I don't know what name he goes by here. But I saw him when they brought me in, and I recognized him.

topics.topic_text: I work independently.
topics.response_text: Hmm... perhaps not, then.

topics.topic_text: How many agents of the Legion *are* there here?
topics.response_text: I know of only the one other. Though I wouldn't be surprised if there were a great many.

topics.topic_text: I understand.
topics.response_text: Good. But for her to trust you to re-enter the room, she'll need to believe you've been doing what she expects of you.

topics.topic_text: Go over that one more time.
topics.response_text: Very well.

topics.topic_text: [Speech] You must miss giving orders, now that all your men are dead.
topics.response_text: [?] Foot soldiers of the Legion are trained to not have to think for themselves - to have conflict removed from their minds.

topics.topic_text: [Speech] Sounds to me like you were too gutless to follow Caesar's orders.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I'll show you gutless, you sniveling bastard. I'll spill your guts all over this room!{Losing his cool.}

topics.topic_text: You're a danger to him alive. Your knowledge threatens him.
topics.response_text: [?] I've told them nothing. They've gotten nowhere. I'm a centurion, for Christ's sake. I deserve his trust.

topics.topic_text: Caesar's laws are absolute. He does not grant exceptions.
topics.response_text: [?] You have to let this go. I'll disappear. No one will ever see me again. That was always the plan in the first place.

topics.topic_text: So in addition to treason, you're also a deserter.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] No! That's not what I meant! I-

topics.topic_text: You sure talk tough for someone who's afraid to die.
topics.response_text: [?] You think I could get where I was in the Legion army if I feared death?

topics.topic_text: But I want to know how a coward can attain the rank of centurion.
topics.response_text: [?] Coward? I've faced odds that would make your NCR soldiers wet themselves.

topics.topic_text: I'll be right back.
topics.response_text: Take your time.

topics.topic_text: You shouldn't have done that. I'm the only friend you have right now.
topics.response_text: [?] You've made your intentions clear. The Legion has abandoned me.

topics.topic_text: Did you honestly believe you could escape death?
topics.response_text: [?] If I had killed myself then I would've been murdering one of Caesar's greatest soldiers. Either choice is a betrayal of the Legion, as I see it.

topics.topic_text: Oh, but I do, Silus. Unlike you, I follow Caesar's orders.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I've done everything Caesar ever asked of me, and this is how I am repaid? With assassination?

topics.topic_text: [Attack] Lucky you. You can borrow my dentures when I knock all your teeth out.
topics.response_text: It'll take more than that to get me to talk, worm.

topics.topic_text: If his empire falls, it'll probably be because his centurions are so gullible.
topics.response_text: What? What do you mean?

topics.topic_text: I'll be the judge of that. Let's hear what you've got to say.
topics.response_text: Something is wrong with Caesar. Something he is attempting to hide from his men. But it was obvious before we set out on this last mission.

topics.topic_text: [Attack] If you've got any last words, you'd better say them now, Legion scum.
topics.response_text: {LATIN}Cedo nulli.{SAY-dough NOO-lee. "I yield to no one." Said defiantly through gritted teeth.}

topics.topic_text: You've been tricked, Silus. I'm working with the NCR. I just got you to talk.
topics.response_text: No! You slimy bastard!{outrage - realizing he's been tricked.}

topics.topic_text: And if you can't go through with it, you look even weaker.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You think I'm going to slit my throat for some megalomaniacal self-appointed dictator?

topics.topic_text: I think I've heard all I need to. You've been very helpful.
topics.response_text: I hope the Legion burns your wretched body at the stake when they conquer this place.

topics.topic_text: Who's the operative?
topics.response_text: I don't know. I know he sends intelligence by radio in the middle of the night. Sometimes that intelligence would find its way to my century.

topics.topic_text: I don't believe you. You're lying.
topics.response_text: Then you're a fool. That man reports to Caesar on what I do here. The Legion isn't going to take me back.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I'll beat some more useful information out of you.
topics.response_text: Beat me all you like, but it won't make my information any more useful. You can take what I have or leave it.

topics.topic_text: There must be more you can tell me.
topics.response_text: There is one other thing that may interest you. I know that Caesar has planted a spy here.

topics.topic_text: Yes, I have it here.
topics.response_text: Good! Give it to me.

topics.topic_text: No, not yet.
topics.response_text: Hurry!

topics.topic_text: [Attack] Then I may as well beat you to death for personal satisfaction.
topics.response_text: Let's see you try.

topics.topic_text: <Continue Listening>
topics.response_text: Time was essential for my mission, but we waited three days for him to dispatch us. Another of his headaches. Does that sound like a man in command?

topics.topic_text: <Continue Listening>
topics.response_text: I haven't breathed a word about the officer we planted here - he continues to radio intelligence to Caesar's camp nearly every night.

topics.topic_text: I'm with the Legion. I'm here to kill you before you talk.
topics.response_text: What? No! Listen, Caesar's secrets are safe with me. I stayed alive because Caesar would've wanted it. I'm useless to him dead.

topics.topic_text: [Attack] Caesar's laws are absolute. He does not grant exceptions.
topics.response_text: Then he's a fool!{enraged}

topics.topic_text: Very well. I'll try and help you.
topics.response_text: I knew you'd be reasonable. Now... how did you find me? Did the officer send you?

topics.topic_text: But not to me. I'll sever your head and carry it with me always - a message to would-be traitors.
topics.response_text: No! Stay away from me!

conversation.response_text: Lieutenant. I was just thinking about you.
You think this'll make me talk? A beating. This the best you can do?
Lieutenant, this woman is an agent of the Legion on a mission to kill me.
Your friend is a miserable fucking degenerate.
